itmo.labs.zavar.commands.base

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • itmo.labs.zavar.commands.base.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddCommand, AddIfMaxCommand, AddIfMinCommand, AverageOfTSCommand, ClearCommand, CountGreaterThanTSCommand, ExecuteScriptCommand, ExitCommand, HelpCommand, HistoryCommand, InfoCommand, RemoveAnyBySCCommand, RemoveByIDCommand, SaveCommand, ShowCommand, ShuffleCommand, UpdateCommand

    public abstract class Command
extends Object
    This class uses to create new commands for your system.
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Zavar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Command

        public Command(String name,
               String... args)
        Creates a new command. In inheritors it recommended to make a private constructor and use super to invoke parent-constructor. Command shouldn't have any public constructors. Every command should have a register() method which adds it to commands' map.

        Example:

        In main class:

        HashMap<String, Command> commandsMap = new HashMap<String, Command>(); TestCommand.register(commandsMap);

        In TestCommand class: 

         
 public static void register(HashMap<String, Command> commandsMap)
 {
	command = new TestCommand();
	commandsMap.put(command.getName(), command);
 }
        Parameters:
        name - command's name
        args - command's arguments (uses for showing help)

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(Environment env,
                             Object[] args,
                             InputStream inStream,
                             OutputStream outStream)
                      throws CommandException
        This method contains main logic of command. This method should be invoked by system to execute command. Don't forget to check invalid arguments when you overrided this method. You can use streams to read/write not only from/to console.
        Parameters:
        env - Environment class, which contains commands' map, collection etc.
        args - command's arguments.
        inStream - input stream to read from it.
        outStream - output stream to write in it.
        Throws:
        CommandException - if something goes wrong while command is executing.
        See Also:
        Environment

      • getHelp

        public abstract String getHelp()
        Returns string with helpful information about command.
        Returns:
        String

      • getUsage

        public final String getUsage()
        Returns string with usage in format: "Usage: " + name + " " + getArgsAsString().
        Returns:
        String

        getArgsAsString()

      • getArgs

        public final String[] getArgs()
        Returns array of command's arguments.

        public final String getArgsAsString()

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Returns name of command.
        Returns:

      • isNeedInput

        public boolean isNeedInput()
        This method should be overrided id command requires additional user input (requires {ELEMENT}). Default - false.
        Returns:
        Returns true if commands requires additional user input.

      • getInputOrder

        public String[] getInputOrder(int type)
        This method returns name mappings for input. Must be overrided if command has additional input.
        Parameters:
        type - Type od order.
        Returns:
        Array with order.
